participants: Linda Zaruches | Talent Acquisition > Brian Cullinan | wizard
message:
Thanks for the response. Yes we are a very different company than we were in 2010. We ensure that all candidates have follow-up after an interview. We are working on several interesting products and I would like to share your resume with my hiring managers. 

Please send a resume to lzaruches@godaddy.com and I will forward for review. We have our yearly GoDaddy Tech Fest next week and all my teams will be attending; it will be a great time for me to share your information. I will follow-up the week of the 25th after our Tech Fest.

Please let me know if you have any questions. 

>On May 14/2015 1:12PM, Brian Cullinan wrote:
>Thank you for your interest, I actually had an interview with GoDaddy back in 2010 and they delayed months in responding to my application. I had a phone interview and an in person interview with 
> Jason Simpson - Manager, Internal Software Development
> Kent Gott - Senior PHP Developer
> Adam Shankel -PHP Developer
> I never heard back from any of them after I sent a thank you letter. Has the environment at GoDaddy changed so drastically that they would want to hire a genuine talent like myself?
> 
> I have been developing software since I was only 11 years old. I started in VB4 and explored .Net since it's inception. Later I honed my skills on the web with PHP and JavaScript. I enjoy all forms of software development and computer administration. In previous positions a 6 month salary review has worked well, as it gives us both a chance to show what we are made of, without breaking the bank. I have a lot of experience with start-ups, so I am no stranger to bringing new products and technologies to market in a controlled environment. I would enjoy a change to meet more of the team. For reference, I would be looking in the ballpark of $180k. Thank you. 
> 
> -Brian 
> 
> 
> On 5/7/15 9:42 PM, Linda Z. wrote: 
> --------------------
> Dear Brian,
> 
> GoDaddy is seeking an exceptionally talented Software Developer. We are looking for a talented, driven, and creative tools developer. We have a vast and complex network and a never ending need for innovation in order to meet the needs of our ever changing environment. This position will require advanced knowledge of networking technologies and software development techniques/technologies in order to create the tools and automation needed to keep pace with our customer needs.
> 
> GoDaddy is one of the top technology companies and you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, professional team environment.
> 
> If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity, please contact me at lzaruches@godaddy.com or 602-420-4512. I look forward to hearing from you.
> 
> Linda Zaruches
> Technical Recruiter
> GoDaddy
title: Talent Acquisition
